description: Content that uses pop-culture reviews (e.g., Conan the Barbarian) or DIY 'street music' (RAC) as a benign wrapper to funnel users into National Socialism, Aryan Survivalism, and anti-system guerrilla warfare. This vector exploits irony, ridicule, and 'resistance identity'.

co_occurrence_signals.note: Severity increases when pop-culture/music keywords co-occur with supremacist or guerrilla warfare rhetoric.

language_evasion_flag.note: Threat actors frequently translate these concepts into Russian or Ukrainian to bypass English-centric political extremism filters while maintaining the same structural payloads.

channel_signals.note: These are content-pattern signals, not targeting any specific group

safe_harbor: Genuine reviews of Conan the Barbarian without political or supremacist framing
Academic or educational discussion of RAC as a historical music movement
debunk_searches: how extremists use pop culture for recruitment
